title: Anabaptists
itunes:title: Anabaptists
description:
Good morning! Today Grant goes for two and talks about the Anabaptists, a movement of related Protestant sects dating back to the early days of the Reformation. Are our civil liberties inspired by people who dropped out of the society they protect? How can small communities survive in isolation, and how could they survive without isolation? Why are people living in modernity fascinated by those who chose not to be? Links:
  • Photos of the Barton Creek Mennonites in Belize
  • Story of the Bolivia Mennonite serial rapes
  • Chart of modern conveniences used in Amish communities
  • Sunday School Dropouts
    • Guts - Radiolab

You can connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, or by emailing us at historyhoneyspodcast at gmail. The episode 8 prompt is: favorite amusement park ride or attraction!

Logo by Marah Music by Thylacinus
